original_title: Sri Lanka cuts petrol to Rs333 a litre, diesel Rs330 from May 01
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has cut the price of 92-Octane petrol by 7 rupees to 333 rupees a litre and diesel by 15 rupees to 310 rupees a litre from May 01, state-run Ceylon  Petroleum Corporation said.
Octane 95 petrol was cut by 10 rupees to 365 rupees a litre. Euro 4 super diesel was cut by 135 rupees to 330 rupees.
The landed cost of petrol was 223.80 rupees and diesel 224.60 rupee a litre, the ministry of power and energy said.
The gap between the import cost and retail price is mostly made up of taxes.
The cost of importing kerosene was 242 rupees a litre. Sri Lanka generally underprices both diesel and kerosene promoting the use and import of more expensive and polluting fuels.
The tax on petrol was 77 rupees and on diesel 55 rupees in April per litre. (Colombo/May01/2023)
